result.execSummary:
The defendant SAMUEL P HYZER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.
must have no new crimes within one year
must pay fine in full and commit no new crimes

State and Defense make sentencing recommendation.

08:44 AM Defendant SAMUEL P HYZER in court with attorney Matthew Kolell.  Defendant SAMUEL P HYZER in custody.  Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dep. S. Copsey sworn & testifies.  Witness id's DE.  ADA Kaupie request Court take judicial notice of bond in Portage Co. case 20CF437.  Atty Kolell objects - not a certified copy.  Court will take judicial notice of bond as certified copy is easily retained.  No cross exam.  Closing arguments.  
Court finds probable cause,  (understands defense's position), binds the matter over for trial.  

ARRAIGNMNET:
ADA Kaupie - will file information that mirrors complaint.   Atty Kolell - proceed to arraignment.  Court enters NG plea 

BOND MODIFICATION:
Atty Kolell - parents unwilling to post bond, but willing to take DE back into home.  Requests signature bond.  ADA Kaupie - does not object to $2000 SB w/same conditions.  Court amends bond to $2000 SB w/same conditions.  
 Final pre-trial scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
